N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 18 ยง 489.16 - Capacity

State Regulations
(a) The total number of residents, including persons receiving respite care or
persons placed under protective services for adults, persons receiving adult
day care services and/or persons receiving room and board, may not exceed six
unless prior written approval is granted by the social services district
pursuant to section
489.12
(b)(2) and
(3)
of this Part. In determining whether to
approve a request by an operator to exceed certified capacity, the social
services district must consider the impact on the family-type home residents
and the ability of the operator to care for additional persons in need of care
and supervision. (b) This section
does not apply to family-type homes for adults that were certified and were
serving more than six adults prior to the effective date of this
section. Notes
